capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and often conflicted personality. capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's lineage is indeed from a pure-blood wizard family. I've always found it interesting that his parents were part of the wizarding world, despite being Muggle-born themselves. It just goes to show how complex and multifaceted the wizarding world can be.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by the history of the wizarding world and the different families that have played a significant role in it. Harry's lineage being pure-blood is quite interesting, isn't it? I mean, he comes from the Gaunt family, which has a pretty complicated and dark past. But at the same time, his mother, Lily, was a Muggle-born witch who chose to marry into the family anyway, which shows that even in the most unexpected ways, love can conquer all.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have.
